Package com.metal.kit.vapor.Interfaces

Interface Playable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Cctv, Character, Dog, Enemy, Guard, Player
public interface Playable
Interface for the player and enemy entities. This interface defines the basic actions that must be implemented for playable entities.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    attack(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Enemy> enemies, com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Sound shootSound)
    Allows the entity to attack enemies.
    void
    die()
    Handles the death of the entity.
    void
    move(float delta, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map)
    Moves the entity along the X and Y axes based on the elapsed time (delta).
    void
    takeDamage(int damage)
    Applies damage to the entity.

  • Method Details

    • move

      void move(float delta, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map)
      Moves the entity along the X and Y axes based on the elapsed time (delta). The movement logic should be implemented in the classes that implement this interface.
      Parameters:
      delta - The distance to move based on the elapsed time (usually called within the `update` method).
      map - The game map that is used to manage collisions or interactions with the environment.

    • attack

      void attack(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Enemy> enemies, com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Sound shootSound)
      Allows the entity to attack enemies. This method should handle the logic of the attack, including applying damage and managing associated sound effects.
      Parameters:
      enemies - The list of enemies present in the game that the entity can attack.
      shootSound - The sound to play when an attack occurs (such as a shot or a strike).

    • takeDamage

      void takeDamage(int damage)
      Applies damage to the entity. This method should be implemented to reduce the entity's health, manage status effects, and trigger events like death if the health reaches zero.
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage inflicted on the entity.

    • die

      void die()
      Handles the death of the entity. This method should be implemented to define the specific behavior of the entity when it dies.
